docs.snippet: From the highly interesting special dispatches from various points, which we publish this morning, it will be seen that the disunion feeling in the South has already reached its culminating point, and that a calmer condition of the Southern mind
docs.lead_paragraph: From the highly interesting special dispatches from various points, which we publish this morning, it will be seen that the disunion feeling in the South has already reached its culminating point, and that a calmer condition of the Southern mind

docs.snippet: The Independent is jubilant over the election of Mr. LINCOLN. It says, in commenting on the result:

headline.main: RELIGIOUS INTELLIGENCE.; Spirit of the Press Notices of Religious Movements Services To-morrow. THE RELIGIOUS PRESS AND THE ELECTION. Religious Services To-Morrow.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Independent is jubilant over the election of Mr. LINCOLN. It says, in commenting on the result:

docs.snippet: The United States Mail steamer Quaker City, R.W. SHUFELDT, Commander, arrived at this port yesterday afternoon from Havana, having left there last Monday, 5th inst., at 1 P.M.  An investigation of a very serious character took place on the 30th ult.,...

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE QUAKER CITY.; Loss of the American Ship China by Fire---Safety of the Crew. Mutiny on Board the American Bark Champion--Havana News--The Slave-Trade--Miscellaneous.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamer Quaker City, R.W. SHUFELDT, Commander, arrived at this port yesterday afternoon from Havana, having left there last Monday, 5th inst., at 1 P.M. An investigation of a very serious character took place on the 30th ult., before THOMAS SAVAGE, Esq., United States Vice-Consul General in this Island, upon charges preferred by JAMES B. NICHOLLS, Master of the ship Champion, of Bath, Maine, against Alex.

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN GERMANY.; The Elbe Tolls--An Unhappy Bookseller--The Elector of Hesse--New Arrests in Hungary--Dr. Barth--The Last Joke of the Saxan Police--The Weber Festival--The Jubileum at Berlin, &c., &c.

docs.snippet: WENDELL PHILLIPS achieved a lecture at Boston, on Wednesday evening, which proved to be a speech on the election of LINCOLN. The Atlas reports it as follows:

headline.main: WENDELL PHILLIPS ON THE ELECTION.; A General Onslaught upon Lincoln, Seward, and People in General.

docs.lead_paragraph: WENDELL PHILLIPS achieved a lecture at Boston, on Wednesday evening, which proved to be a speech on the election of LINCOLN. The Atlas reports it as follows:

docs.snippet: Instructions to Gen. JONES, touching the unsettled questions with New-Granada, were completed to-day, and after being considered in Cabinet to-morrow, will be forwarded to him at New York.

headline.main: NEWS FROM WASHINGTON.; Instructions for Our Minister to New-Granada--The Peruvian Claims to go over forMr. Liucoin's Administration. ANOTHER STEAMBOAT BLOWN UP. Arrival of the Empire City at New-Orleans. The New-York State Printing. The Steamer Chippewa Valley Sunk. Confiagrations. Naval Intelligence. Amusements.

docs.lead_paragraph: Instructions to Gen. JONES, touching the unsettled questions with New-Granada, were completed to-day, and after being considered in Cabinet to-morrow, will be forwarded to him at New York.

headline.main: HOW THE RESULT IS RECEIVED.; Demonstrations and Speculations at Lincoln's Home. CONJECTURES ABOUT THE CABINET. The President's Policy to be Conservative...Disunion Scouted. Sentiment of the South for and against Disunion. State of Feeling at the National Capital. Probable Course of Southern Federal Office-Holders. Comments of the Press North and South. ADDITIONAL ELECTION RETURNS. Alarm at Washington--Silence of President Buchanan--Gen. Lane Ridicules the Idea of Secession--No Resignations. The Feeling in the South--The Secession Sentiment not generally Popular--Message from the Governor of Georgia--No Movement in South Carolina. The Sentiment in Virginia--Comments of the Press--No probability of Any Movement towards Secession. Prospect of the Secession of South Carolina ?Action of the Legislature?The Resigned Federal Officeholders, &c. Message of the Governor of Georgia--He Does Not Approve of Calling a Southern Convention--Important Recommendations. Great Wide-Awake Demonstration to be Made in Hartford.
